CatDescriptText: Mrs. Gilbert King, 13A Hays Manor, McKees Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the recreational facilities for young people in Pittsburgh are adequate? If not, what do you think should be done about it?" answer reads: "I do not.  Where I live in McKees Rocks, I think a lot more places where the children can go for recreation are needed.  In this way, they will be kept out of trouble.  Taxes should not be increased in order to pay for the additional recreational facilities."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Gilbert King wearing light colored coat with one button unfastened, and light colored fringed head scarf, posed in front of flecked granite wall
